page.title: 12CUMBERNAULD CIVIC WEEK
page.content: EVERY YEAR IN JUNE THERE IS A CIVIC WEEK IN CUMBERNAULD.THERE ARE EVENTS LIKE COMPETITIONS, A GALA AND SPORTS. LOTS OF PEOPLE TAKE PART. OUR FESTIVAL QUEEN THIS YEAR IS LORRAINE McBIRNEY, SHE IS 15 YEARS OLD AND WILL BE CROWNED ON CUMBERNAULD FAIR DAY.SOME PEOPLE IN SACRED HEART PRIMARY SCHOOL HAVE BEEN INVOLVED IN CIVIC WEEK ACTIVITIES. FOUR BOYS WON MEDALS AT A SWIMMING GALA AND ONE OF THEM WON A SHIELD AS WELL. FOR THE LAST THREE YEARS OUR SCHOOL HAS WON THE GARDENING COMPETITION. THERE ARE OTHER EVENTS LIKE FOOTBALL GAMES, A DANCING FESTIVAL AND A MODEL RAILWAY EXHIBITION. MANY PEOPLE COME TO WATCH AND CHEER AND THE PROVOST AND LOCAL COUNCILLORS COME TO PRESENT PRIZES. THE LOCAL PAPER, THE CUMBERNAULD NEWS, COVERS THE EVENTS OF CIVIC WEEK. WE LIKE TO READ ABOUT THE PEOPLE WE KNOW.
